alert.note: Alert for Lamar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 4:18PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lamar County through 445 PM CDT... At 417 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Soper, or 15 miles west of Hugo, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paris, Lake Crook, Arthur City, Powderly, Sumner, Camp Maxey, Pat Mayse Lake, East Direct, Forest Chapel, Direct, Garretts Bluff, Midcity, Chicota, Globe, and Belk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for north central Texas.
